datagenerator.generators
Class CustomWieghtGenerator

java.lang.Object
  datagenerator.generators.CustomWieghtGenerator
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class CustomWieghtGenerator
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

This generator loads data from a comma spaced value file into memory and then randomly returns entries from the data. This generator is designed to work with weighted data.

Author:
Patrick McMorran
See Also:

Constructor Detail

CustomWieghtGenerator

public CustomWieghtGenerator(java.sql.Connection c,
                             java.lang.String File,
                             boolean u)
This is the constructor for the generator.

Parameters:
c - This is the connection object used to interact with the database.
File - This is a string containing the path to the CSV file which this generator uses for data.
u - This boolean value denotes whether the generator should produce unique values. True = unique.
Method Detail

PrepareGenerator

public void PrepareGenerator()
This is used to prepare the generator, creating required tables in the database, loading required data into memory, and handling any other dependencies.

nextTuple

public java.lang.String nextTuple()
This method returns a string containing a randomly selected value from the CSV file supplied to the generator.

Returns:
This String contains a random value from a csv file.

public void DestroyGenerator()
This performs cleanup operations, deleting temporary tables and indices.
